post.description:
Add a command that should be sent to a specific device 

Rights

- *Connectivity environment*: ENVIRONMENT_ADMIN

- *Monitoring environment*: SENSORS

fields.description: How form fields should be sent to the server when creating them.

startAt.description: Timestamp the device should execute the command. The system tries to share the command with the device before that time. If null, the device should execute it at time of receival + command.delay. It depends on the commandType whether startAt can be null

delay.description: In seconds. Only relevant when startAt is null. The command should then be executed by the device at time of receival + delay

endAt.description: Timestamp the device should stop execution of the command.

channelIndices.description: The device channels for which this command is relevant. See commandType.channelSelect for allowed values.

email.description: An email will be sent to all provided email addresses when the command is executed by the device

x-code-samples.label: shell
x-code-samples.source:
# You can also use wget
curl -X POST https://api.withthegrid.com/command/ \
  -H 'Content-Type: text/json' \
  -H 'Environment-Hash-Id: yourAssetEnvironmentHashId' \
  -H 'Api-Version: 5' \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer {access-token}' \
  -d '{
  "objectType": "device",
  "objectHashIds": [
    "j1iha9"
  ],
  "commandTypeHashId": "x18a92",
  "fields": {
    "interval": 86400
  },
  "startAt": "2019-12-31T15:23Z",
  "delay": 0,
  "endAt": null,
  "channelIndices": [],
  "email": []
}'

start.description: 'required': user must provide command.startAt. 'optional': user can provide command.startAt or a delay for the command to start after it is sent to the device. 'disabled': user cannot provide command.startAt nor a delay.

end.description: 'required': user must provide command.endAt. 'optional': user can provide command.endAt. 'disabled': user cannot provide command.endAt.

showIf.description: Show this field if other field with provided key is set to provided value. Referenced field must exists already

items.description: Defines which data can be stored in form fields.

fieldConfigurations.description: See the chapter on open fields on how to use this

channelSelect.description: When creating a command of this type, the user can then optionally choose one (in case of 'single') or more channelIndices (in case of 'multiple') for which this command is relevant. If 'off' is chosen, the user cannot specify channelIndices

environmentAccess.description: 'full': end-users can view, create and delete commands of this type. 'read': end-users can view but not create and delete commands of this type. 'none': end-users cannot view, create or delete commands of this type.

  -d '{

      "key": "id",
      "name": "untranslated string",
      "showIf": {

        "value": "string"
      },
      "hint": "untranslated string",
      "allowNull": null,
      "valueOptions": null,
      "type": "string",
      "defaultValue": "string",
      "inputType": "text",
      "regex": "string",
      "prefix": "untranslated string",
      "suffix": "untranslated string"
    }
  ],
  "channelSelect": "single",
  "environmentAccess": "full"
}'

post.description:
Get claim tokens for one or more devices. These claim tokens can be used in a monitoring environment to claim these devices. This request invalidates older claim tokens for these devices. Suppliers cannot acquire a claim token for devices that have already been claimed by a monitoring environment. Users in a monitoring environment cannot acquire a claim token for devices that are linked to a pin group. 

Rights

- *Connectivity environment*: ENVIRONMENT_ADMIN

- *Monitoring environment*: SENSORS

x-code-samples.label: shell
x-code-samples.source:
# You can also use wget
curl -X POST https://api.withthegrid.com/device/claim-tokens \
  -H 'Content-Type: text/json' \
  -H 'Accept: text/json' \
  -H 'Environment-Hash-Id: yourAssetEnvironmentHashId' \
  -H 'Api-Version: 5' \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer {access-token}' \
  -d '{
  "deviceHashIds": [
    "j1iha9"
  ]
}'

post.description:
Add a certificate to the connectivity environment that can be used to create device client certificates. 

Rights

- *Connectivity environment*: ENVIRONMENT_ADMIN

certificate.description: A Base64 encoded intermediate certificate. Should be used to create device certificates.

subscriptionHashId.description: Right now the user gets automatically subscribed to alerts on this object. This hashId can be used to remove such an alert

csr.description: A Base64 encoded PKCS#10 certificate signing request

identifier.description: A javascript function that returns deviceType and identifier. See the chapter "User defined code"

x-code-samples.label: shell
x-code-samples.source:
# You can also use wget
curl -X POST https://api.withthegrid.com/supplier-certificate/ \
  -H 'Content-Type: text/json' \
  -H 'Accept: text/json' \
  -H 'Environment-Hash-Id: yourAssetEnvironmentHashId' \
  -H 'Api-Version: 5' \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer {access-token}' \
  -d '{
  "csr": "-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE REQUEST-----
MIHhMIGHAgEAMCUxEjAQBgNVBAoMCWRldmVsb3BlcjEPMA0GA1UEAwwGeGQycmQ0
MFkwEwYHKoZIzj0CAQYIKoZIzj0DAQcDQgAEyHDE7farWQdLw/HDgOcbt9BU8ba6
fEvEY79Z47ozYQ6LAt6wYEW/4Aq4Eir1kSCw/DtououtnpaQokZQkGYf2aAAMAoG
CCqGSM49BAMCA0kAMEYCIQCHf/bilJwxF+7V/0mifsXK4U0PUHDe0YNBorb2dBzc
KAIhAK59odu1i8oxIJg237EOLKbf0k/Rhub/CKPrsQ50t0lK
-----END CERTIFICATE REQUEST-----",
  "identifier": "function (command) {
  return JSON.stringify({
    hashId: command.hashId,
    commandTypeHashId: command.commandTypeHashId,
    startAt: command.startAt,
    endAt: command.endAt,
    settings: command.settings,
  });
}"
}'

enforceTwoFactorAuthentication.description: Determines whether users need to have two factor authentication enabled in order to access this environment.

environment.description: A random monitoring environment this user has access to

notificationLevel.description: The user is subscribed to every issue created on locations in this environment (0), when the issue gets serious (1) or when the issue gets critical (2). If null, the user is not autmatically subscribed to new issues.

userEnvironmentSettings.description: User speficic settings for an environment

siNumber.description: Significant number. Its value is significand * 10 ^ orderOfMagnitude. It has as many significant figures as the significand has (except when the significand is 0, then the number of significant figures is not defined)

unit.description: Will be displayed with an SI-prefix (eg. k or M) if relevant

defaultOrderOfMagnitude.description: Defines default order of magnitude to be selected at manual report form

disableSiPrefixes.description: Will disable SI-prefixes for this quantity if true

fileFromServer.description: Information about a stored file that can be used to download or inline it

anyOf.description: The values that can be stored in a form field

fields.description: The field configuration is stored in the fieldConfigurations key of the monitoring environment object

anyOf.description: The values that can be stored in a form field

deviceFields.description: The field configuration is stored in the pinFieldConfigurations key of the channel key in the device type object

level.description: 0: no serious or critical open issues, 1: one or more serious open issues an no critical open issues, 2: one or more critical open issues

pin.description: A port. Always part of a pin group. All measurements are recorded at pin level. When a device is connected to a pin group, its channels are to be connected to the pins of the pin group.

anyOf.description: The values that can be stored in a form field

deviceFields.description: The field configuration is stored in the pinGroupFieldConfigurations key of the device type object

deviceLinkHashId.description: If null, there is no device installed at this location

level.description: 0: no serious or critical open issues, 1: one or more serious open issues an no critical open issues, 2: one or more critical open issues

pinGroup.description: A collection of pins. Is called a "location" in the GUI. A device can be connected to a pin group. Condition reports are registered at pin group level.

measurementThreshold.description: Called an "Issue trigger" in the UI. A limit on measurements of a certain quantity. If a measurement outside these limits is registered, an issue is automatically created (if there isn't a relevant one open yet)

fileToServer.description: Data that should should be sent to the server when uploading a file

anyOf.description: The values that can be stored in a form field

fieldToServerFull.description: The values and files that can be stored in a form field.

fields.description: How form fields are returned by the server.

startAt.description: Timestamp the device should execute the command. The system tries to share the command with the device before that time. If null, the device should execute it at time of receival + command.delay

delay.description: In seconds. Only relevant when startAt is null. The command should then be executed by the device at time of receival + delay

endAt.description: Timestamp the device should stop execution of the command.

channelIndices.description: The device channels for which this command is relevant. See commandType.channelSelect for allowed values.

command.description: An instruction for a specific device

start.description: 'required': user must provide command.startAt. 'optional': user can provide command.startAt or a delay for the command to start after it is sent to the device. 'disabled': user cannot provide command.startAt nor a delay.

end.description: 'required': user must provide command.endAt. 'optional': user can provide command.endAt. 'disabled': user cannot provide command.endAt.

level.description: 0: no serious or critical open issues, 1: one or more serious open issues an no critical open issues, 2: one or more critical open issues

edge.description: A geographical object representing one or more connected series of line segments. Called a "line" in the GUI. If the edge only consists of 1 segment, it should be connected to a node on both ends.

anyOf.description: The values that can be stored in a form field

fields.description: The field configuration is stored in the fieldConfigurations key of the monitoring environment object

grid.description: A collection of locations (pinGroups), port (pins) or nodes. In the GUI, only pinGroup grids are used.

node.description: A geographical object representing a point. Is used to connect one or more single segment lines.

userHashId.description: If null, the comment is created by an automated process

issueComment.description: A comment on a specific issue

endAt.description: If null, the issue is still open

closedAt.description: If null, the issue is still open

issue.description: A problem or remark about a specific pin group (or pin).

label.description: A label can be used to tag issues with.

channelIndex.description: The channel of the installed device. When null, the measurement is not taken by a device but manually entered

channelMeasurementIndex.description: Not null for device measurements. Represents the device channel this measurement is taken from, see the channels key in the device type object.

orderOfMagnitude.description: The measured value is significand * 10 ^ orderOfMagnitude. It has as many significant figures as the significand has (except when the significand is 0, then the number of significant figures is not defined)

significand.description: The measured value is significand * 10 ^ orderOfMagnitude. It has as many significant figures as the significand has (except when the significand is 0, then the number of significant figures is not defined)

performance.description: -1: not compared to thresholds, 0: within thresholds, 1: outside serious thresholds but inside critical thresholds, 2: outside critical thresholds

measurement.description: A value representing a measurement of a certain quantity at a certain pin by a device or human at a specific point in time.

measurementFilter.description: An object that contains the configuration to search through measurements.
